website_summaries.verdict: A great quality controller made by Nintendo so it is fully compatible with all Switch features.
pros: Very comfortable to hold with some weight to it without being too heavy
Ideal for those who feel the Joy-Cons are too small
Features HD rumble and is amiibo compatible
Comes with a charging cable and has great battery life
cons: Home menu button is in a slightly awkward place

customer_reviews.title: Great controller... wish the price were a bit lower
customer_reviews.text: I keep giving Nintendo my money. I bought it as I started playing Zelda BOTW and didn't particularly like playing with the joycons attached. Hated to lay out another 70 bucks for a controller... but I did and I'm satisfied. Build quality on this is better than my Xbox, and the battery lasts seemingly forever. I love the feel of this compared to the Xbox controllers too. Damn you Nintendo... now I have 4 joycons (for mario cart), plus an extra controller, plus a charger, plus the plastic steering wheels. What will you make me buy next :).
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice controller, deserves a longer warranty period
customer_reviews.text: My left thumbstick broke with light use. The warranty is only 3 months which is not long enough for such an expensive product. The Nintendo Switch console has a 12 month warranty and so should this controller.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great for adult Mario Kart Drivers!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. Bought so I could play Mario Kart with my 11yo on his new switch (joy cons + adult hands = no good, IMO) I let him figure out how to set it all up and he had it connected and working in less than a minute - so if an 11yo can do it, I suppose anyone can! We didn't bother with the directions. Definitely recommend for playing on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole R.

customer_reviews.title: Have a Switch, then you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly a great controller. Better of course than the Joy-Cons that come with the Switch. The analog sticks are smooth in movement, the D pad suffices, the buttons aren't too small and the triggers are nice. Being an owner of a PS4 Pro and an Xbox One S its my opinion that the Pro Switch controller is the most comfortable I've used. Ergonomic and nice to hold. Shame it doesn't come with the Switch but the controller is a luxury to have so the purchase is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mord13th

customer_reviews.title: Left joystick not working after light use.
customer_reviews.text: I expected this controller to work longer than 6 months. After very light use(I own a ps4, xbox and gaming pc) of the controller, within 6 moths the left joystick stopped working in the up position. I only use the pro controller when playing more than 2 player games like mario cart. I contact amazon support and nintendo support they told me the controller has past the 3 month nintendo accessory warranty, so an exchange is not possible. Nintendo mentioned a $40 dollar repair fee since it is out of warranty. Very disappointed with nintendo because the pro controller is very pricey. Again, I expected this to work longer than 6 months with very light use.
customer_reviews.author: kxsl

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting quality, Don’t buy! There are better controllers!
customer_reviews.text: If you know what a good controller is then you will understand how terrible this controller is. The fact that there is no microphone jack for a 70$ controller is horrible, the fact that Nintendo is based around games that use a d-pad and this is the worst d-pad they have ever released because it misreads your inputs is shameful and half a scam. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CONTROLLER. You can get a good controller for half the price of this thing that will fit all your needs casual or competitive. And if you’re worried about the amiibos, don’t. Your joycons have the feature so you don’t need to waste your good money on this junk. DISGUSTED
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: 90 DAY WARRANTY, NOT 1 YEAR WARRANTY - LEFT STICK DRIFT
customer_reviews.text: The controller is great when it works. A few months out the left controller stick started to "drift" (as many people have complained about in other reviews as well) and when I contacted warranty support they claimed it had only a 90 day warranty -- even though the warranty PDF on the amazon site under warranty information says "hardware" has a 12 month warranty. Seems like they should clarify what "hardware" is in their warranty -- seems like a controller is "hardware" to me. Also seems like they should fix/correct the defect in their product since this appears to be a very common problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Areff

customer_reviews.title: Great themed Pro Controller for Xenoblade Fans!
customer_reviews.text: I love the artwork and color choice for this controller. As this is my first Pro Controller on the Nintendo Switch, it works great. Has the same "rumble" feel as the joycons (JOY CON BOYZ) and is just a lot easier in your hands which = less cramps, better ergonomics and thus gameplay is enhanced. Charges with a USB-C cable included in the box. Nothing much else to say. This is great for Xenoblade Chronicles 2/Switch fans and those who love the color theme!
customer_reviews.author: Cool Spot

customer_reviews.title: Bought two. One is Defective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They are great controllers. Unfortunately, on one of them, the left joystick activates downward every few seconds. It has a mind of its own. This is devastating in Zelda BotW. Yea, I’ve recalibrated, blah blah. Several times. Turns out this is a regular defect. Just google it. For $60, that’s shameful. You can watch it on the calibration screen. Just randomly jolts downward when I’m not even touching it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ XybepteK

customer_reviews.title: Joystick and button sizes are too big
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning. The joysticks on the controller are much different than on the joycons that come with the Nintendo switch. Personally, after playing in handheld mode, and switching to the docked version playing with the pro controller, I noticed the joysticks are much bigger and you have to push them “farther” to get any response in the game. So it felt as though there was a lag after using the joycons which have as much “smaller” or I guess “shorter”? Joystick. For me, I did not like the button design shape or size, as it did not enhance my playing experience
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE the Switch but weren't fans of the teeny tiny ...
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE the Switch but weren't fans of the teeny tiny controllers for two-player games. I bet they're perfect for kids but my hands are just too fat for that. We bought two pro controllers (one for me and one for my husband) and just love them. We feel like kids again, playing MarioKart after the actual kids go to sleep!
customer_reviews.author: EmTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Failed after four months
customer_reviews.text: Two of these were delivered November 30, 2018. By March one of the joysticks was malfunctioning. Have tried recalibrating several times but it doesn’t improve. The joystick physically moves, but doesn’t communicate to the game properly. For example, in Splatoon while moving through the plaza the character will run, then walk very slowly, then stop, then walk slowly again, then run. It’s not reliable for gameplay. We have no complaints about the second controller. Battery life is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Parker

customer_reviews.title: best designed pro controller that can be bought.
customer_reviews.text: This takes an almost perfect controller and fixes my one complaint, the "D" pad. There is now a pivot for the "D" pad which fixes any issues with pushing directly up or left and right without it going in both directions at the same time. The design is very nice, but I do wish the red was more bright. It is more of a pink than a red, but that is a tiny non-function affecting preference. It might not be worth it to buy this as a replacement, but if you don't have a pro controller I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: S.Nak

customer_reviews.title: Controllers eventually start giving bad input.
customer_reviews.text: Out of 4 new controllers, all of them eventually developed problems. Either the joystick starts giving weird feedback (like moving forward is jerky), or the d-pad starts messing up. Tetris 99 is UNPLAYABLE with my pro controller because about 30% of the time I hit the left button, it also triggers the top button which drops the block down. When I play with the joycon, I have no problems. These controllers feel great to use until they stop working properly. We sent one to Nintendo to be repaired and the one that came back developed the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: D. Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Pulls to the left after a month.
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo. I am very displeased. The Joycons have this issue already, and I didn't expect it from this. However, I am guessing they use the same hardware between the Joycons and Pro Controller because the left thumbstick pulls. I just bought this to replace another that started after two years of use. It started happening to the new one right after the return window closed, too. I am so disappointed, but they are willing to work with me to do a free repair. I will revisit this if anything else notable happens.
customer_reviews.author: SweetDaesTop Contributor: My Little Pony

customer_reviews.title: Stick drift is an issue.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the pro controller for about one year before the left stick started drifting down. I cannot use the controller at all because the drift is so bad that it drastically pulls down during gameplay and in menus. A quick search online shows that this issue is not rare. Due to the price of this controller and the stick drift problem, I cannot rate it higher.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Left stick breaks after a few months of use - had 3 of these
customer_reviews.text: While this is the best feeling Switch controller out there, the stick quality is awful, and it WILL break after a few months of good use. Everyone I know with one of these gets the same issues with the sticks. I just spent $200 on a soldering kit, replacement parts, and fixed my controller after several weeks' worth of practice. But you could just avoid all of that and not buy this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The best Switch controller currently available
customer_reviews.text: The rumors that the D-pad was improved for the Xenoblade model appear to be true. I get far fewer unintended button presses on perpendicular axes with this unit than I do with my original dark gray unit. In my opinion, this is the best Switch controller currently available from a functional standpoint. The cosmetic design is quite good and matches the aesthetic of the game well, without being crass or visually busy. The controller also appears with red handles in the console controller menu, making it easy to distinguish at a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: it is a used controller buyers beware
customer_reviews.text: i still cannot find where does it say refurbished, but i paid almost the same as retail price and got a used controller.. the picture advertised shows the box and the controller i did not get the box i got the controller wraps in plastic.. i got very angry because now when you order from amazon you don't really know what you going to receive... i could not send it back because it was too expensive... very dissapointed with my purchase...i will buy everywhere else and if i don't have any other option then i will consider amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Love the way it feels, but it feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: For a 70 dollar controller, this thing feels FLIMSY. If you lightly shake it left and right, you can hear stuff moving in them. And the grip handles of the controller are wobbly . Not built to last it seems. But love the feel and look of it. Nintendo needs to step up.
customer_reviews.author: DDN

customer_reviews.title: much more durable than joycons.
customer_reviews.text: I would 100% recommend any one that has a switch getting this because the joycons are not very durable. I have had my switch for a few months and the joycons are already having problems from just regular use (I am not a huge gamer maybe play this a few hours a week). The left joycon stick is messed up and will keep inputting that I am pressing forward to move character when I have stopped this has caused me to walk off many a cliffs in breath of the wild. Get this and use it anytime you are playing in docked mode cause the joycons will just not last.
customer_reviews.author: home cook

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The Xenoblade pro controller looks and feels great. Big fan of the Xbox controllers. In many ways, I prefer this controller over that. Buttons are big, clicky and responsive. The thumbstick is nice and firm. But this controller is unreliable. I thought I was unlucky or got a defective but I've used two different pro controllers where both the thumbsticks drift even when brand new. Right out of the box, my Animal Crossing character moves without me touching the controller. And the camera moves too. After reading all the great reviews and being a long-time Nintendo fan, I was left extremely disappointed. There's no excuse for this kind of quality at the price these go for.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A Better Way to Play
customer_reviews.text: This makes playing the Switch much easier. I don't have huge hands, but after two hours of playing using the Joy Con controllers (both attached and detached from the console), my hands felt stressed and a bit cramped. This controller feels like it was made of a higher quality than most and is somewhere between the PS4 DualShock 4 and the Xbox Pro Controller in terms of feel and quality. I absolutely love it and after playing for about 10 hours on it over the past week, I can say that if you intend to play Breath of the Wild or any other games on your TV that require a controller, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Poor design - left joystick breaks
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these. They feel great, but the left joystick breaks after about 40 hours of use from white dust that collects under the joystick. The fix is to buy a new controller or disassemble and solder in a replacement joystick costing $12.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Never buy used controllers.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t pay attention that the description say “used-like new” which isn’t the case. The controller frequently inputs Right on the joystick as if I was holding it down when I’m not. If this has ever happened to one of your controllers you know it is extremely frustrating & basically makes the controller unusable in most cases. It’s unfortunate I work overseas in a remote location so I don’t have the luxury of just going to the post office to return this. So I left this review to show my frustration. NEVER BUY USED CONTROLLERS.
customer_reviews.author: Hasan Reed

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just over a year. Bought name brand to avoid this issue!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Purchased this just over a year ago and the controller is having alot of glitching issues. Expected better purchasing an official Nintendo product. Specifically purchased Nintendo name brand for that reason. I can't recall if I was offered a warranty when I purchased, but it doesn't appear I purchased one. If it offers you one... Take it! We paid over $70 for this, so would have been worth the warranty. Nintendo, this really should have lasted more than a year. Previously review: Feels very high quality and comfortable. Works well with switch. Worth the extra money for name brand with the added motion control feature.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly B

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo did this controller the right way!
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this Nintendo Switch Pro Controller on a deal for about $50, which is a super deal. Regardless of the price the Pro Controller has been an awesome companion for my Nintendo Switch and now more, sinde Joy-Cons started drifting. This controller is wireless, no crazy delay, and it works! Love it comfortable to play with. Pros: Comfort Battery life Response Quality Cons: Price (More expensive than a DS4) No color variarion options
customer_reviews.author: Eddy04Tv

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Pro Controller $59.99 vs Nintendo Joy Con at $79.99! 😮
customer_reviews.text: The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller gives a nice feel and better control handling than the original Nintendo Switch game controller provided with the o.g. purchase of your Nintendo Switch;For the price of $59.99 with Prime Free 1-2 Day Shipping and Handling,Compared to the Nintendo Switch Joy-Con Gray Controller or The Neon Red/Blue Joy-Con Controller,which usually sales for $79.99! Comment: ("The Nintendo Pro Controller will provide a: strong in-hand control,Wired or Wireless control,Rechargable up to 40 hours before its next charge,and Prefect for those lenghty videogames,such as Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild,which can turn out to be a "4 month long" Adventure! Commen:t ("wink-wink 😉 on the ⛔Spoiler Alert⛔ regarding the Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild"!🔥)
customer_reviews.author: david vargas

customer_reviews.title: Pyra pro controller
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller. I own the switch obviously and the Xbox one and ps4 and this is my favorite controller out of all 3. It is not only a fantastic design but it also feels as good as it looks, making the long gaming sessions of Xenoblade Chronicles 2 that much more enjoyable. In my opinion it was well worth the extra 5 dollars for the looks. Also the buttons are the same "emerald green which I didn't notice at first but is a great touch. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brown

customer_reviews.title: Drifting issue
customer_reviews.text: Thia controller is awful. I bought it to replace my other controllers that have joystick drifting issues and as soon as I turned thia new one on to use it, it started drifting horribly. Ita even worse than my older controllers. I would give zero stars if i could. Edit: just in case anyone was wondering I bought thia controller new not used
customer_reviews.author: danielle k

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go renewed. 1st party is nice, but used is maybe not the way to go
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Don't go refurbished on these in my opinion. Never was able to charge the controller. The orange light indicating charge never came on. Unfortunately have to return this bad boy. ORIGINAL: My product seemed pretty used when I purchased it from the Amazon warehouse. I'm still glad I got a first party controller and Amazon is good with their customer support. But it just doesn't have that new controller feel. I was borderline about to return it. I sanitized it and everything, but I really miss the new feeling for the extra 10$.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT but HORRIBLE in the same breath.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this controller is GREAT, except ONE important detail... Which is why it gets 1 STAR. (I would put NO STARS if I could) When using this controller, the left directional thumbstick changes direction randomly at the WORST possible moments. It feels like a flaw in the design, where it overshoots from snapback. If you press the thumbstick all the way one direction and then let go, (which happens naturally when I play), it snaps back into position, then overshoots and changes direction. When playing platformer games, (which I'm CrAzY about), this flaw makes the games nearly unplayable. Considering the cost, this is an issue that should NOT exist. Most disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize how laggy this controller is til I switched
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the switch pro. I played a ton with with controller over 9 months until the controller would occasionally drop down inputs. I swapped out the pro controller in a realtime competitive multiplayer game, and my performance instantly improved. The pro controller is slow and laggy. I'd recommend avoiding it. Certainly better than joycons, but it's pricey with weak performance.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Renaud

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - CONSISTENT AND REPLICABLE DEFECT
customer_reviews.text: It's a great controller that obviously has a serious defect. This is the second pro controller I've bought that have the same issue. The left joystick (upward control) stops working after a month's worth of play. I primarily use it to play Splatoon 2, which requires the user to use the up joystick motion the majority of the time. It's expensive for a typical controller, but it's worth it because of the motion control; however, as I mentioned, it's got a big defect that definitely needs looking into. I've also researched the internet and other users who play Splatoon are having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: It’s so much better than the joycons. The joycons are convenient for easy transportation and multiple players, but they left one gets drift SO easily. It’s ridiculous that Nintendo hasn’t solved that issue yet (other than offering free fixes). The pro controller is much sturdier and comfortable ergonomically. The battery life lasts pretty long after being charged. I like it a lot and have no regrets spending the money to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Love the controller
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be hard to get used to the controller after using the Switch built-in controllers for a while, but that was not the case. Even though it doesn't feel the same as holding the Switch unit, it feels pretty natural. It has good weight, and the feedback feels almost identical to the Switch joy cons (or whatever they are called). Haven't run the battery down yet to see just how long it lasts, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck W

customer_reviews.title: Nicest feeling controller out of all the consoles
customer_reviews.text: Every button on this feels amazing, the controller feels very solid. And built in battery too is great. I had to get this because I sit about 10ft away from my TV and the joycons seem to have trouble at that range. This has complete solid connection and fixed my issue, but after using it I realized just how uncomfortable the joycons are relative to this. If you like using the switch docked a lot it’s definitely worth the buy. And you’ll have two controllers for split screen as a bonus. I have quite large hands and this feels like it was made for me
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: It’s a little pricey. But it does feel good in your hands and it has the Amiiboo reader in it.
customer_reviews.text: I was “forced” into buying my first one during the great Switch shortage of 2020. GameStop bundled a switch, game and a controller together. No switch by itself. It was actually one of the best deals seeing as amazon and eBay only had switches marked up by 2-3 times. I ended up really liking this controller. The joy cons are too small to use as an adult. My hands would cramp after a little gaming. The GF ended up taking over my switch with ACNH and this controller. So when I finally was able to get another switch. This time through bestbuy with no bundle. I decided I needed this controller for myself again.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable controller
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable controller, probably one of my favorites! The only gripe I have is connecting it. My SO and I each have a Switch, but purchased one of these to share. In order to pair it, you have to briefly plug it into the console you want to connect with. No easy connecting with the shoulder buttons like the Joycons have. Once it's paired though, it stays paired. Battery life is fantastic. I still rate it five stars because the pairing issue is a unique one that most people will never experience. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not For Incremental Movements
customer_reviews.text: Is an okay controller and takes some getting used to for certain games. Not recommended for incremental movements for games that require motion detail, unless you're willing to spend extra time practicing for that specific game or unless the game has that all movement where you can physically direct the controller to position on screen. Once you know how to work it, it's okay; the joysticks are kinda stiff meaning they either go one way or the other and you can't move just right in a smooth, slow motion if you need to do it quickly like a computer mouse. Does last a long time on one charge which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the Joycons
customer_reviews.text: I originally didn't see much point to buying these, considering the Switch has a built in controller. But after struggling through games like Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild, I finally broke down and purchased this. Wow, I have to say it made quite the difference. Even after a few spills, the controller keeps on functioning (albeit some of the buttons are a bit harder to press now).
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ward

customer_reviews.title: The best control that's ever graced my undeserving hands.
customer_reviews.text: I've been gaming since 2000. I've owned every major console since. Out of all the first party controllers that have ever existed, this is the highest quality one I have ever used. I wouldn't say it's worth spending almost 1/5th the amount of the actual console to have, but you won't be disappointed if you do. It COULD ruin your experience with the Switch. It becomes 'another thing to carry' (as the Switch was built with portability in mind). IF you travel frequently and want to purchase this and the Switch at the same time I'd actually recommend waiting awhile before ordering this. Get used to the Joycons. You don't NEED this to enjoy the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Jones

customer_reviews.title: Switch Pro definitely an upgrade. Still not perfect, but pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: The Switch Pro Controller works pretty well, but I wish there was a hard-off, as it will turn itself on in travel and if you are using your Switch in handheld mode and someone or something messes with the Pro Controller, it will hijack your game. This also can prematurely drain the battery. It is comfortable to hold on my medium to large sized hands and a bit daintier than the replaceable battery version by the same brand. Charging is convenient with the same cable I would use for the Switch. Can be used plugged in. After a while of use thumb caps tried to pop off. I make sure they are seated well before a session of play.
customer_reviews.author: Elder Keithulhu

customer_reviews.title: Works with Steam too! And Android!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously it works with a Switch. But it also works with Steam, over regular bluetooth. Steam even lets you swap the a/b and x/y buttons to make it like *every other controller* where the bottom button is yes and the right button is no. Not only that, it works with Steam Link on android, which passes the full controls through, meaning you don't need any special configuration on the Android side, the Steam configs work just like they do when you connect it directly. I'm super happy with this setup, it lets me have one controller for all my games, no matter what I'm playing them on.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Albertine

customer_reviews.title: Best Switch Controller
customer_reviews.text: Great controller. I opted to get this version over the black pro controller and it paid off. It was more expensive, but luckily I was able to grab it at retail price on Amazon (that one day they actually had it available) than the jacked up ones you see everywhere now. Feels very high quality, all tight, nothing loose whatsoever. I can’t imagine ever playing the Switch without this now. Only downside is the pink color, but eh...nothing wrong with a little standout color here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Benny D

customer_reviews.title: Control Freak
customer_reviews.text: The pro controller is a fantastic peripheral for the Switch; many pros just a few cons. Pros -build quality, heft, overall hand feel is great -buttons feel good, just the right amount of resistance when pressing -easy to connect -long battery life -slick look, nice design -tech, HD rumble and NFC for amiibo -allows for more comfortable long gaming sessions Cons -expensive, only bought it because I had a gift card -no color options, lack of choice -analog sticks have too much travel, feels sluggish for smash bros
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Controller is great, but D-pad is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The controller is great. The size and position of the buttons feels natural. It also has the capability of motion controls and amiibo support. However, the d-pad is really lacking on this controller. It's so lacking that I feel like it deducts 2 stars all on it's own. The reason the d-pad is so bad is that it will completely mess up your button presses. It's not uncommon to push left on the d-pad but have it register as up. This happens with all the directions. If Nintendo fixed the d-pad, this would be the best controller of all time.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: D-pad is the worst of any controller I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This controller gets 2 stars because of it's comfort. However, I'm 2 for 2 on d-pads that register the wrong direction half the time. A simple google search will reveal how wide spread the issue is with people coming up with at home repairs. I can't perform the at home repair cause it appears one of the screws is so cross threaded I can't get it out. It's a real shame because barring the d-pad issue it's a great controller.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for long gaming sessions on the Switch
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for anyone who intends to seriously play on the Nintendo Switch for hours on end. The joy-cons are an interesting concept and are sometimes fun to use, but ergonomically speaking, they're not the greatest for long gaming sessions. That's where the Pro Controller comes in and saves the day. This is a well-made controller with pretty good haptic feedback. It fits well in the hands, and has good quality buttons and texture. The battery also lasts quite a while, and can be recharged using the included USB-A to USB-C cable, which can be attached to any USB-A port on the Switch's dock, or plugged into an appropriate USB-A wall outlet or adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this controller for my husband about 8 months ago. He was really into smash bro’s and BOTW at the time and his hands were getting fatigued from using the joycons. He absolutely loved the gift and uses it every time he decides to play. As an added bonus, I was able to reap the benefits from this controller when AC New Horizons came out. Overall, the quality of this controller is great and it is just as nice now as it was pre 2000 hours of play time. I would 100% recommend a pro controller to anyone that has a switch.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: can't beat a genuine
customer_reviews.text: The joy sticks that come with the Switch feel flimsy and are not too ergonomic. They may work well as single controllers, but putting them together into one is not a good feel. I also have to admit, not many games I play (maybe none) work with a single joy con anyway. This feels more like a PS4 controller, which I am more used to. It's expensive, rarely goes on sale, but it is the real thing, not a knock-off like some of the others. I have a third controller for the times when three of us want to play, but I probably should have just got another genuine Pro controller.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Left Stick degrades quickly
customer_reviews.text: As many other 1-star reviews have stated, the left stick degrades and starts to drift after a couple months of play (conveniently just outside of Nintendo's ludicrous 90 day warranty period). The running theory is that bits of plastic from the stick rub off into a white dust and then gets stuck inside, interfering with the sensors. I usually don't recommend off-brand controllers, but when you're spending twice the price on something that'll be worthless in a couple months, how can you not go with the competition instead?
customer_reviews.author: Steffen Sprow

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Saying Joycon Drift isn't a problem is a lie!
customer_reviews.text: I've had both one of my joycons and now my pro controller both experiences drift and make basically all games unplayable! It's mind-blowing that Nintendo would apologize for joycon drift in their controllers but also say its not a problem! it's a very big problem when my controller is stuck in the down position!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Miller

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but necessary for switch owners who play shooters
customer_reviews.text: The cost of this controller is pretty hard to swallow, but I think it’s necessary for any Switch owners who play shooters. Pros: - extremely high quality - battery life is seemingly limitless - much more precise aiming - more comfortable than joy cons, especially if you have big hands. Cons: - expensive - doesn’t work for all games (but most). For example, Pokémon let’s go. The quality is better than Xbox or PS4 controllers. If you play shooters or have big hands, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gwynne

customer_reviews.title: Favorite controller
customer_reviews.text: I really like these controllers. I prefer them over the Joycons. One warning is that they have a known issue. The joysticks will create dust when you use them, and this dust eventually causes drifting. Mine lasted for over a year with so many hours of gameplay I can't really complain, but I also made sure to keep the dust from getting into the controller. I have heard that some people's controllers start drifting in as little as a month. You can also choose to get metal joysticks, which are easy enough to install. This will prevent the dust issue entirely. I give this product 5 stars based on my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: A good improvement over the joycons, with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very comfortable. It feels great in my hands, is nice and weighty, and I appreciate the larger buttons. Analog sticks are bigger and longer than the joycons, which makes movement and aiming much more precise. So far, the wireless signal has been flawless, and the battery life is great (at least 30 hours). The one and only downside to this controller is the D-Pad. It's too sensitive. For example, when you press "right", it often activates the up or down directions as well. It makes 2D platformers a bit of a pain, and Tetris 99 is nearly impossible with this D-Pad. If it weren't for this problem, it would be a perfect controller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more joy-con drift
customer_reviews.text: My son was complaining about joy-con drift with his first generation Switch. I purchased two of these. So far, so good. They were packaged nicely and arrived quickly. Also, these are easier for adults to use versus the joy-cons, which are pretty small. They are rechargeable, which is nice (no more messing with replacement batteries and battery acid like our old wii controllers). They are also really well constructed and appear durable. Hopefully they will last a while because at $60 each, they are not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: IKE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent controller
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good controller. Easily tied with the Xbox 360 controller for my personal favorite. The analog sticks are excellent, responsive, but soft. This results in an extremely smooth feeling actuation, which is a common theme for this controller. All the buttons are nice and soft, but firm. Tactility is on point. The controller itself is also a good size for my large hands. USB-C is much appreciated. My one criticism is the translucent plastic used for the faceplate. I get the aesthetic they were going for, but it just reminds me of the dreadful electronic shells of the early 2000s.
customer_reviews.author: Dayne Neidlinger

customer_reviews.title: 2 controllers have failed within 8 months, Nintendo said $80 to fix both
customer_reviews.text: I have two Pro controllers bought at separate times. One started disconnecting and reconnecting rapidly, then would lock up and become unresponsive. It would not shut off (even if forced) until the battery ran out. Updated firmware, re-sync'd it, did everything the Nintendo support said to do, nothing worked. They will not exchange, they will just try and repair it for $30 plus shipping for each controller. So far every controller i have bought for the switch has failed. Nintendo can't make reliable controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bruzdzinski

customer_reviews.title: The best controller ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly the best controller on the planet. Even better than the good ol xbox360 controller. It's rechargeable (Type C USB), long battery life, HD Vibration which feels really good and adds a lot to games. Very good D-Pad and it's built really good. Pay the extra money and get what will last you a LONG time. Oh, and there is NO drift. If Nintendo only made their joycons this good.
customer_reviews.author: MegaDeth859

customer_reviews.title: Best Controller for Switch!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with this controller. It is the best controller to use when playing games on your Nintendo Switch on the Television. The joycons in the joycon grip is just a bit too tiny and cramped for my fingers to play games like Smash bros and Hyrule Warriors. This controller is great and extremely comfortable. I dare say its the best Nintendo controller made, next to the Gamecube Controller of course which is the best controller ever. I highly recommend buying this! It may be a bit expensive but it is a must!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good as they come
customer_reviews.text: Controllers made by the manufacturer of the game systems tend to be the best and that is true in this case. If you want to spring for the real deal, this is it. I have not tried any of the off-brand controllers in the past but I have with other consoles and its always the same thing, they do not last and they are not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jabroni

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Got this with promo which is 59 before tax. I just feel that price and the quality doesn’t match. In other words, this controller should not be this expensive. Well it’s bit heavy for my wrist to hold it. The controller needs to redesign to make it more comfortable. Well now my sibling is using it since he likes it. This product is depends on your hand size and how you feel once you play it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ding

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: We were going to purchase a set of joy-cons until we read up on this. So glad we went with a pro controller than another set of joy-cons! It's extremely comfortable in hand, the design is basically just like an xbox controller which we love. My only gripe about it is the home, plus, minus & select buttons in the center are very poorly placed & could stick up a bit more too. I find that when I go to hit the plus I hit home by accident. Just a small thing but annoying nonetheless. Either way, I do recommend this controller though, it's a great addition!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rothrock

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 months - ironnically after the warrenty expires. Do NOT buy this controller because it will not last. Very disappointed because it was rather expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Drift in Control Stick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two controllers a few months ago and just got around to opening the second controller. The left control stick has a permanent drift so my characters are constantly moving, cars always drift to the left, etc. Unfortunately I didn't notice this until after my return window, so I'm stuck with it. Amazon linked me to some guides to disassemble my controller, so I guess that's my next step. I would be wary in purchasing these controllers - at the very least, make sure to test them right away!
customer_reviews.author: Walt Lasley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Controller
customer_reviews.text: I understand some people are having issues with the controller drift problem, but I haven't seen or occurred those problems on my device. It feels great in the hand and all the controls are very easy to use. Battery life has been very good, and I have also been able to use it on some compatible PC games. Been using it for about a month and it definitely improves the gaming experience. I hope the device continues to work properly and I will update this review if anything occurs later on.
customer_reviews.author: Emig_96

customer_reviews.title: So satisfying to use.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best-feeling controller I’ve ever used. It’s got a nice heft, the rubberized grips feel good, the sticks and buttons all have very satisfying feedback, and best of all I can use it to turn on my Switch. About the only issue I have with it is that since the D-Pad is so close to the left analog stick and the - and + buttons are in a slickly different position and not raised, it’s a pretty big adjustment from using the Switch’s Joy-Cons in Breath of the Wild. I find myself having to think before and while I’m trying to use those buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cable stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The controller itself is great, no issues there. However, I don't know at what point the USB-C cable that came included stopped working. There's numerous reports of the Switch and this controller NEEDING the official Nintendo cable to charge. Well, after only using this cable for a few weeks, it suddenly stopped working. I don't even know at what point this happened because I had not played my Switch in a while. TL;DR: Controller is great! Included USB-C Cable is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Saul E.

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: One thing that held me up from playing our Switch were the terrible controllers that come with it. For my large hands, they are impossible to use singly, and even when mounted together, the spacing is way off and strange. With Smash Brothers Ultimate being released in December, these controllers were a necessity. They fit the hands nicely, they are well built, and I feel like I have finer control over any game I play. Docked one star for the cost. Seriously, Nintendo? Drop $20 off the cost and I'd give five stars. One nice feature is that they can be charged with a common USB-C cable, meaning that we no longer have to spend money on proprietary power supplies.
customer_reviews.author: -=Rudy=-Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: So much more comfortable to use than the standard Joy-Cons
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this controller is a huge improvement over the standard Joy-Cons that come with the Switch. The controller has a nice heft to it and fits larger hands a lot better than the standard Joy-Cons. My hands don't cramp up using this controller like they did with the other ones. It feels very well made. The analog sticks have a better feel to them with greater resistance than the standard Joy-Con. The buttons are larger and firmer. The vibration feedback is improved as well. Battery life is great too. If I had any complaints it would be that not all games support the controller, some for more obvious reasons than others.
customer_reviews.author: VirtualMirage

customer_reviews.title: OK I like the controller
customer_reviews.text: OK I like the controller...did not like the price but that's my bad for choosing to pay that much. I was buying the switch for my husbands 61st Birthday. He never asks for anything for his self. He is not a Gamer...The only gaming he has gotten into is Zelda. We have bought a new console for each Zelda and he's played each and everyone one.. I am what my grandsons call a Back Seat Gamer. We enjoy the time we spend together with Zelda! So I chose to pay the extra $35. Hubby Deserves it with out a doubt..
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: The best Switch controller.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to get an officially licensed PowerA pro controller for like half the price but decided on the real deal. This controller is solid, has a nice weight, and the battery lasts for a long time between charges. The Power A ones have Nintendo's blessing but you lose rumble and the NFC reader. I'm not super worried about those features but I didn't want to need them in the future and come up short. If I buy a 2nd controller I probably will get the licensed aftermarket one and not spend as much as this thing (which is a little absurd for a controller).
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Switch To Pro
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in perfect condition. After using a switch for a few years the joycons controller grip that comes with the switch started to grow more and more uncomfortable. I had gotten a couple of switch controllers but you really cant beat this. This controller has all of the fucntions, aside from being able to split in half, and feels like a normal controller. Feels great and works great and this is a must have for any switch owner. The mailing process was great and the product works great.
customer_reviews.author: Thank You Reviews

customer_reviews.title: thank you nintendo
customer_reviews.text: They are a little too small for my hands, and I am not a "big" guy at 5'8" - if my height is any indication of my hand size. The 2 small controllers that come with the system when put into the holster to create a pro style controller really does have the best, most comfortable, feel to me but those controllers always lag and have problems. These at least work consistently. Thank you nintendo for the imperfect system controllers and essentially forcing me to use these less than ideal controllers instead.
customer_reviews.author: dSal

customer_reviews.title: Solid Controller, although expensive
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I'll have to admit that, although this is a good controller, it's still a bit too expensive compared to what other competitors such as Sony and Microsoft offer. Pros: - Well built - Design, it's semi-transparent, the patterns inside looks cool - Comfort - Good battery life, my battery life never goes below 50% even though I only charge them twice every week (and using it every day) Neutral: - No analog triggers, so far it doesn't bother me at all. I prefer digital triggers personally. Cons: - Price. :/
customer_reviews.author: HolyShiits

customer_reviews.title: Feels awesome, a little quirky
customer_reviews.text: The control feels great in hand, one of the best feeling controllers. My trouble with it is that on certain games the left Joystick gets stuck and on some games it doesn't. Also the chip reader is not sensitive and can really struggle to read amiibos. If this controller was $30-40 i would still give it 5 stars, but because its $65+, it definitely takes away some of the luster of the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hall

customer_reviews.title: Every switch owner needs one
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this controller. The placement of the buttons - the quality. i've had mine almost a year and I'e had no issues with it. I am a little bummed that I read that the latency is behind the wired gamecube controller. Even when u connect the controller to the switch via a wire it is still behind the gamecube, which doesn't make sense. Luckily this only matters for competitive fighting games, so unless you're planning on bringing your controller to competitive tournaments, you're good. Every switch owner needs this controller.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the standard JoyCon controllers with the Switch. I knew I was going to invest a bunch of hours into Breath of the Wild, so it seemed a no brainer to get a controller that fit my hands better. It seemed better to go with the name brand in this case and this controller has been worth every penny! The range is decent, the controller is holding up well, and the fit is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Lee

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Im a xbox gamer mostly, but i do love nintendo. Once i put the controller in my hands, it just melt into my hands, really comfortable. And the controller is way better than the joycon grips. Since i use xbox controllers, it was natural to me. My second favorite controller, my favorite is still the xbox one controller. Is it exspensive yes, is it worth it yes. Overall if you use xbox controllers than i recommend this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: westley hadden

customer_reviews.title: This controller is the best you'll get for a switch
customer_reviews.text: This controller is the best you'll get for a switch. It feels very nice in your hand, and looks pretty decent too. I think the buttons are responsive, the sticks feel comparable to the other two big guy's controllers. I wish the console supported analog triggers but for digital triggers these are fine. I prefer the batteries be rechargeable (which these are) as long as they don't lose their ability to hold their charge anytime soon, but so far so good. I wish it were slightly cheaper, but you'll prefer this to the joy cons for sure.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fazzi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compliment to your Switch.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this controller. The key benefits are as follows: -Top of the line build quality -Ease of use. Connects to your docked Switch without any hassle with pairing. -USB-C charging and plug and play. At this point, every piece of portable technology should be using this standard. Minus one star for the ridiculous price point. $70 at the time of review is price gouging. I only bought it on a quick sale for $10 off, which is at least a bit more reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for Immersive and Comfortable Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I can't play my Switch without it. With the Switch undocked and the JoyCons locked in place it's bearable, but anytime I have my Switch docked and am using a TV I can't bear with the strange placement for the joysticks. If you're used to a DualShock controller from the PlayStation line-up then this is a MUST for you. Unless you own and constantly use a 3DS and a PS Vita you won't find the JoyCons very comfortable. The build quality is sturdy, and feels like a premium controller while still harboring a great texture and feel for your hands.
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I'm kinda mad at myself for not buying this before playing through Zelda: Breath of the Wild. This is an absolute must-have for the Switch. It's very sturdy, has stellar battery life and much better signal strength/distance than the standard snap-in controllers. My one complaint is the sharp plastic ridge between the right grip and the central controller body. I think it was a molding error because the other grip transition is smooth, as you would expect it. I'm not going to sand it down or request a return or anything, but it's a noticeable edge, especially when moving my right thumb from the joystick to the A/B/X/Y buttons in long sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for those games you don't want JoyCon for
customer_reviews.text: Original product, working perfectly! Much better to play certain games with this controller than using the Joy Con. Breath of the Wild, I'm looking at you. Battery charge lasts pretty long, I've actually never run into a period where the controller died on me, but thankfully everything on the switch is USB-C so you can top up quickly and easily. I recommend getting an extended USB-C cable just in case you're a heavy player.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Good until it started drifting
customer_reviews.text: I loved this controller. It was great for about 2 straight years. I probably put in close to 300 hours on it playing on the switch. The battery life is longer than other controllers and ergonomically fits in my hands well. Nintendo is notorious for having controllers with drift issues, I didnt believe this applied to their pro controller but it does. It WILL eventually wear down and youll have to get a new controller. Granted I put in a lot of hours, i had to dock a star for the drift.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I purchased this product, wish I bought this sooner. Nice and sturdy, the wireless play makes it worth every penny. Highly recommended for gamers. Easy to connect and the battery lasts for a good amount of time and charges very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good products but more expensive than my expect
customer_reviews.text: I have to give a two star not for this product. But for the joy-cons controller from Nintendo. The left Joy-cons are always easy to become uncontrollable after about 100h usage which is in really poor quality. I think this is the way which nintendo promotes us to buy this pro controller. Actually this pro controller has much better perfermance. But it is not easy to carry away as nintendo switch is easy-carried on game consellors. Hope nintendo can improve this problem in the furture.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The pro controller stops working after about 5-6 months of playing smash. Nintendo has really dropped the ball with their controllers on the switch. Had my mom mail me my old gamecube controllers and console. It's really ridiculous that 10+ year controllers work better than these cheaply made pieces of garbage. Don't get me started on the joy cons. Those are even worse
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: 90 hrs of use d pad locking up
customer_reviews.text: Update: After a few more hours with the d pad jamming, it cleared up. Controller has run well for several weeks now. Previous: Played just short of 90 hrs total with this thing. Good: comfort, larger buttons, gyro, rumble, Bluetooth reach Poor: d pad is sticking (jamming) and not depressing fully. (Heavy usage in Breath of the Wild on the up arrow). Played about 65 hrs of BOTW.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: don't buy unless you enjoy gambling.
customer_reviews.text: the design of the controller is good, it fits well in my hands and it feels good to use. Until it drifts, i've only used it for about 6 hours and now the left joystick drifts and it makes playing games difficult i thought these issues were sorted out but apparently they haven't been, if you're lucky enough to get one that works then id say its worth the purchase however i cant recommend spending the money for one, don't buy it, just get replacement joy cons and save your money on something that may or may not work.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Nunez

customer_reviews.title: very high quality controller!
customer_reviews.text: i'm very impressed by this! it simply feels excellent to use. the joysticks are very smooth! usb-c charging is very nice as well i have tried to use this on my pc as well, and it works excellently for that. in steam there is a setting you can enable to change the button layout to mimic a standard xbox 360 controller type layout, instead of the Nintendo button layout, and that makes it feel right for gaming on the pc.
customer_reviews.author: willy pete

customer_reviews.title: One of the best controllers for any console.
customer_reviews.text: Must have for any Switch owner who spends a decent time having it docked and playing on your TV. it really is up there with the other console controllers and probably even better than the PS4 and Xbox One controller. it just has a great feel to it. Maybe it's the size of my hands, but it just feels right. The D-pad had issues on earlier models and I know this is a revised version, but I haven't noticed the issue anymore. A lot of my games dont require much use from them, so I havent been able to fully test it either.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: awkward but most usable controller I have tried
customer_reviews.text: The weight is good. I wish the left-side thumb control and direction pad were reversed but all the other brands I tried which are reversed feel too light and cheap. The Nintendo controller is overpriced compared to the other options (I have tried four other controllers) but this is the one I return to because of the feel. I am not really satisfied with any of them because all of them angle my hands wrong so that my thumb is not really aligned with the sticks and pads as would be more natural. This one, though, is the least awkward and most usable for me.
customer_reviews.author: seabumb

customer_reviews.title: Amazing controller. Great for extended gameplay.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing battery life comfort and familiarity. The first time i took it out of the package and held it i naturally gripped it and it felt great. Has stood up to multiple days of Botw binges without charging! The build quality is top notch. Very nice semi transparent dark plastic material on the controller. The Joy Con Grips are great little controllers but for long extended periods of play i highly recommend a Pro controller. It has made playing Botw for me much better having an actual D pad. No complaints on joy sticks either! Buttons all feel great too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Givens

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Nintendo Switch gamers
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get the pro controller since I have (2) Joy-con. I got to say this is one of the best controllers I ever owned, I would say is even better than the XBOX One controller. The size, grip weight, standard vibration plus accelerometer its all in one package. But surpassingly one of the things I love must is the buttons and analog joy sticks, they feel right, and right size. You need to have one of these to understand, its like playing with nintendo buttons quality (NES/SNES) but in a pro version.
customer_reviews.author: M83

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: If you want to play some serious Zelda, I recommend having this in your hands. Going into battle with this controller really makes a difference on button control and performance. The only thing that can get irritating is that once in a while during a serious battle, you go into the scope mode. The joysticks push-down features are pretty easy to engage.
customer_reviews.author: SER

customer_reviews.title: Quality Controller
customer_reviews.text: Quality controller! Good weight in the hand and much more crisp and responsive than the joy con controllers. There are 4 LEDs that indicate controller order (multiplayer games), that also flash when the battery runs low. Recharges via usb-C.
customer_reviews.author: Thegirlontheleft

customer_reviews.title: Great controller but do you actually want this?
customer_reviews.text: This controller is pretty good for people wanting an improvement over the Joy-Cons that come with the console. It has almost all of the features the Joy-Cons had (there's no IR sensor), it feels pretty good (doesn't feel cheap at all!), and it has a great battery life. Compared to the Switch's included Joy-Cons, this controller is larger and has a directional pad. Overall, it's a very fantastic controller. However, if you're buying more than one, the price adds up rather dramatically, as they cost $60-$70 each. If you want a cheaper (but still great) alternative, PowerA makes Nintendo-certified USB controllers for under half the price, though these do lack motion control and rumble.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Stops working within a couple months. I have bought the Nintendo Switch Pro controller TWICE now
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. This has turned me off of the Switch. I bought a Nintendo Switch Pro controller when I originally got my Nintendo Switch. It stopped working within a few months. I thought, okay, maybe I got a shitty controller, it happens. So I buy this one as a replacement on Amazon and it stopped working already! Why can't I get a replacement???? Another trash product from a once great entertainment company. I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Josh
